qas.question: The economic goal of the state was to serve as what for the ruler?

answers.text: consolidation and extension of the ruler's power

qas.question: In what regions concepts was the Ottoman economic system based on?
What was a way to reach the economic goals of the Ottoman economic system?
What was the final goal of the state economic system?

answers.text: to increase the state revenues without damaging the prosperity of subjects

qas.question: What did the state economic system hope to avoid?

context: The Ottoman economic mind was closely related to the basic concepts of state and society in <a1_0>the Middle East<a1_0/> in which the ultimate goal of a state was <a0_0>consolidation and extension of the ruler's power<a0_0/>, and the way to reach it was to get rich resources of revenues by <a2_0>making the productive classes prosperous<a2_0/>. The ultimate aim was <a3_0>to increase the state revenues without damaging the prosperity of subjects<a3_0/> to prevent <a4_0>the emergence of social disorder<a4_0/> and to keep the traditional organization of the society intact.
